definitions.definition: to make a long, very high sound or cry:
examples: We could hear the piglets squealing as we entered the farmyard.
The threat of further changes in the education system is making teachers squeal.

definitions.definition: to give information to the police about people you know who have committed a crime:
examples: When he finds out who squealed on him, he's going to make them very sorry.

definitions.definition: a long, very high sound or cry:
examples: Erik collapsed into giggles and squeals as Penny began tickling him.
